items.title: Tips for Assembling Micro-medical Devices
Four US Cities Top List of Global Innovation Clusters
items.summary: - *WIPO's Global Innovation Index* maps top clusters by the density of inventors, scientists, and venture capital activity, often spanning borders. - In 2025, the top 10 includes Shenzhen–Hong Kong–Guangzhou, Tokyo–Yokohama, San Jose–San Francisco, Beijing, Seoul, Shanghai–Suzhou, New York City, London, Boston–Cambridge, and Los Angeles, with four U.S. metros among them. - *China* leads with 24 clusters, the U.S. 22, and Germany seven, showing cross-border networks that extend beyond single cities.

items.title: Medical Device Firm Invests $20M in PA Plant
items.summary:
- **$20 million** investment to expand and modernize the *Hanover Township* assembly plant, creating at least **200 new full‑time jobs** and retaining **1,704** positions.
- Pennsylvania provides **$1.5 million** in support—**$1 million Pennsylvania First grant** and **$500,000 WEDnetPA**—to train workers, plus a new workforce training center at the site.
- The *Lehigh Valley* region hosts more than **170 life‑sciences establishments** employing over **6,000** people, underscoring a robust local ecosystem.

items.title: Honda Halts Production at Mexico Assembly Plant Over Chip Shortage
items.summary:
- Honda halted the Celaya, Mexico plant due to a *semiconductor shortage* tied to a Dutch-Chinese chipmaker dispute, the first confirmed impact on a Japanese automaker.
- Production is being trimmed in the U.S. and Canada, with *North American output* reduced as *chip supplies tighten*.
- The wider auto sector faces ongoing disruptions as *Nexperia*-related constraints and export blocks ripple through supply chains, with potential cuts also eyed in *Brazil* and other manufacturers.

items.title: Dispensing Technology Supplier Coherix Expands
items.summary:
- Coherix is expanding in Ann Arbor with a 25,000-sq-ft facility (+$1M) to boost production and product development, adding 10–15 engineering jobs.
- The Innovation Center will house 10 robotic dispensing stations and demo areas, powered by *AI* and *3D-vision-enabled adaptive process control* for adhesive dispensing.
- The move aims to meet demand, accelerate *precision dispensing technology* development, and partner with EMA and Eastern Michigan University for education and future factory initiatives.

items.title: Foxconn to Deploy Humanoid Robots on Production Line at Houston AI Server Plant
HOLON Opens First U.S. Facility in Jacksonville
items.summary:
- **HOLON** will build a 580,000-square-foot facility at *Eastport Industrial Park* in Jacksonville, Florida, marking its first U.S. manufacturing site for autonomous shuttles.
- Groundbreaking is scheduled for April 2026 with operations expected in the second half of 2027, and the project will generate over *$200 million* in local economic impact during construction, create more than 800 jobs (including at least 150 at **HOLON**), and deliver about *$87 million* in annual economic output starting in 2028.
- The vehicle meets **FMVSS**, **ADA**, and **Build America, Buy America (BABA)** standards; test drives are underway in Hamburg as part of the ALIKE project; and up to 100 autonomous shuttles could be integrated into JTA’s *Ultimate Urban Circulator (U²C)* program in downtown Jacksonville and other U.S. pilots planned for 2026 and beyond.

items.title: GrayMatter Robotics to polish transparent plastics
items.summary:
- The U.S. Air Force awarded GrayMatter Robotics a contract to develop an **AI-powered** robotic polishing system to reduce optical distortion in transparent acrylic and polycarbonate parts.
- The system extends GrayMatter's existing technology that autonomously detects and corrects distortions to ensure *clear visibility* and scratch-free surfaces on aerospace components, using physics-based models for safe, accurate operation.
- CTO Brual Shah says the platform can handle sanding complex shapes—from guitars to aerospace components—delivering unprecedented *reliability*, speed, and consistency.

items.title: Course Teaches Plastic Parts for Automotive Design
items.summary:
- *Three-day course* in Troy, MI teaches how to design plastic parts for automotive applications, led by Paul A. Tres.
- Topics cover *material selection*, *design procedures*, processing and assembly methods including in-mold assembly, living hinges, over-molding, press-fit, snap-fits and safety systems.
- Attendees receive the 10th edition of "Designing Plastic Parts for Assembly" and a binder with over 1,300 slides; course runs Nov. 5–7 at Michigan State University.

items.title: Battery Manufacturer Bringing 735 New Jobs to Pennsylvania
items.summary:
- **Eos Energy Enterprises** is expanding in Allegheny County, PA with a **$352.9M** investment, relocating HQ from New Jersey and creating **735 new jobs** (265 retained).
- The plan adds a 432,000 sq ft Marshall Township facility, new lines, and a **40,000 sq ft** Pittsburgh HQ to support its BMS, software, controls, and analytics, with a **Carnegie Mellon** partnership to grow robotics/AI skills.
- Founded in 2008, Eos makes aqueous zinc batteries for utilities and industry, aligning growth with local universities for a skilled workforce.

items.title: Chrysler: A Century of Innovation
Global Robot Demand Doubles Over Last 10 Years
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- In 2024, global robot installations reached 542,000, more than double a decade earlier, with *Asia* accounting for 74% of new deployments.
- The IFR reports 4,664,000 robots in operation worldwide in 2024, up 9% YoY, with *China* leading at 295,000 deployments (54% of global) and the US installing 34,200 units.
- Looking ahead, 2025 is projected at 575,000 installations (+6%), and the count could surpass 700,000 by 2028, signaling a sustained *positive* global trajectory.

items.title: Boeing Cleared to Boost Production of 737 Max
items.summary:
- *FAA* granted Boeing approval to raise 737 Max production to 42 jets per month, a key step toward easing delivery pressures.
- The move follows a 38-per-month cap set after a January 2024 door plug issue on a 737 Max 9 and maintains heightened *oversight* for safety.
- Boeing executives expect production to rise further, with a potential near-term target around 47 jets per month to reassure customers on *safety* and reliability.

items.title: GM Scuttles Production of Electric Van in Canada
Additive Manufacturing Helps Boeing Assemble Satellites Faster
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)

items.title: State Association Urges Tariff Exemption on Medical Device Components
items.author: New Jersey Business & Industry Association (NJBIA)
items.summary:
- **NJBIA** urged the U.S. Department of Commerce to exempt medical-device inputs from broad **tariffs** to avoid higher costs and *supply disruptions*. 
- The group warned **tariffs** could raise prices, slow production, and threaten national security, stressing continued access to global supply chains for medical *polymers*, *sensors*, and *microelectronics*. 
- It called for policy steps like avoiding indiscriminate tariffs, boosting incentives (tax credits, grants, R&D), and improving federal coordination and infrastructure to strengthen domestic manufacturing.

items.title: Higher Fee on H1-B Visas Could Adversely Affect Manufacturers
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- The administration signed a proclamation imposing a *$100,000* filing fee for new H-1B visa applicants to push employers toward *domestic hiring*. 
- H-1B approvals are heavily in *computer-related roles* (about *64%*), with *manufacturing* at about *11%*, and the average salary is around *$120,000*. 
- **Critics** warn the higher fee could hurt *manufacturers* and *innovation*, while **supporters** say it could curb outsourcing and boost American jobs.

items.title: Collaborative Robots May Be Prone to Privacy Problems
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *University of Waterloo* researchers found cobots leak info via network traffic, enabling hackers to identify a robot’s actions with about **97% accuracy**.
- The study focuses on script-based robots and shows encrypted commands can still reveal sensitive details through traffic patterns analyzed by *signal processing* techniques; recommended fixes include adjusting API timing and applying a *smart traffic shaping algorithm*.
- The findings highlight privacy risks as cobots are connected remotely in settings like hospitals or factories, underscoring the need for safer designs.

items.title: Self-Fixturing Tech Could Boost FSW
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- The project introduces a *self-fixturing friction stir welding* attachment on a robotic arm that combines the tool and a miniature backing plate, removing the need for a separate anvil.
- It aims for mass production with *lighter materials*, stronger welds, and lower energy use by enabling *friction stir welding* on non-flat parts without bulky fixtures.
- Engineers are adding a hydraulic system to control the force, moving toward an ergonomic, industry-ready solution for real-world assembly lines.

items.title: Software Links Smart Tech to Digital Work Instructions
Robots Automate Assembly, Testing of Medical Devices
Electric Screwdriver Is Precise
New Product Of The Year Awards And Guided Exhibit Floor Tours To Headline The 2025 Assembly Show
PVA Dispensing Tech at Assembly Show
items.summary: - **Delta 8 3-axis TIM Dispense + Pick and Place** machine with fiducial camera, PC200 and pneumatic grip tool, plus the groundbreaking software *PathMaster X*.\n- **Valve Kiosk Stand** featuring *18 dispensing valves* from PVA’s extensive product line.\n- PVA’s proficiencies in *coating*, *encapsulation*, and *masking* showcased at Dymax Booth #2834 during SMTA International.

items.title: Stellantis Announces Record $13 Billion U.S. Investment
items.summary:
- Stellantis will invest **$13B** in the U.S. over four years—the **largest in its history**—boosting production by 50%, adding 5,000+ jobs, and launching five new vehicles while refreshing 19 models.
- Site breakdown includes **Belvidere IL**, **Toledo OH**, **Warren MI**, **Detroit MI**, and **Kokomo IN**, with major investments to reopen plants, build a **new midsize truck** and **EVs**, and create hundreds to thousands of jobs.
- The plan backs **R&D**, **supplier partnerships**, and **manufacturing upgrades** across 34 U.S. facilities and 48,000 employees, strengthening Stellantis' American footprint.

items.title: Adhesives Play Key Role in Electric SUV
Airbus Inaugurates New A320 Final Assembly Line in Mobile
items.summary:
- Airbus opened a *second* A320 Final Assembly Line in Mobile, doubling U.S. A320 production capacity.
- The project adds **over 1 million square feet** of hangars, paint shops, and logistics space and creates **about 1,000 new jobs**.
- Since 2015, Mobile has delivered **600** A320-family aircraft and the site targets **75** single-aisle planes per month by **2027**.

items.title: Appliance Assembler Automates Leak Testing
Toyota Launches 30-Acre Solar at KY Plant
items.summary: - Toyota's nearly *30-acre solar field* at its *Georgetown* plant will generate about *15 million kWh* annually, powering more than *1,400 homes*.\n- As part of Toyota *Environmental Challenge 2050*, the project advances *carbon neutrality* across all facilities by 2035.\n- Toyota Kentucky — the automaker's *largest global manufacturing site* — employs nearly 10,000 team members and will begin assembling the first U.S.-made *battery electric vehicle* in 2026.

items.title: Despite Challenges U.S. Manufacturing Executives Are Increasingly Optimistic
Servo Hydraulic Press Saves Energy
When Documented Work Instructions Don’t Match Reality
RTA Launches Practical IEC 62443 Course for Plant Floor
items.summary:
- RTA is offering a two‑day virtual course (Dec 3 & 10, 2025) that teaches *IEC 62443* for plant-floor implementers using the practical *SECURE Method™*. 
- Led by Danny "Riverman" Caudle, the vendor‑agnostic program covers *security zones*, RBAC, OT patching, incident response, and network DMZs. 
- RTA warns of rising cyber threats and pressure from boards/insurers/regulators; register at rtautomation.com/cybersecurity-training-class.

items.title: DMR to Open Drone Factory in Louisiana
items.summary:
- DMR Technologies will invest *$1.4 million* to open a 10,000‑sq‑ft drone factory in *Lafayette, LA*, intending to produce up to *1,000 Field Ranger X50* UAVs in its first year.
- The facility is projected to create over *1,200 jobs* (521 direct with avg salary $85,000 and ~766 indirect) and will integrate assembly, rotor manufacturing, quality control, and logistics.
- Louisiana secured the project with incentives including *LED FastStart* workforce training and a $1M performance grant, strengthening the state's aerospace and defense manufacturing base.

items.title: Trump Administration Weighs Billions in Additional Clean Energy Cuts
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is considering canceling *$12 billion* in clean energy funding, targeting **auto manufacturing** projects and **carbon capture** programs.
- At risk are two *direct air capture* hubs (one with **Occidental**) and EV transition grants including *$500M* for GM’s Lansing, *$335M* for Stellantis Belvidere, and *$250M* for Kokomo.
- The move follows a recent *$7.56 billion* rollback and plans to cut nearly *$8 billion* in climate funds for several Democratic-led states, and companies have not commented.

items.title: Deere wins Assembly Plant of the Year
Isuzu Breaks Ground on Production Plant in South Carolina
items.summary:
- Isuzu North America has broken ground on a one-million-square-foot Piedmont, South Carolina facility to produce gas, diesel, and *electric* vehicles.
- The plant will be Isuzu’s first U.S. site with a *variable-model, variable-volume* production system and an advanced conveyorless line to enhance scalability and efficiency.
- Integrated *automation* and flexible design aim to support vehicle *electrification* and long-term growth across Isuzu’s North American network.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz Opens Test Facility for Headlights
items.summary:
- The new 443‑ft, €10.5M *light testing center* at Mercedes' Immendingen proving ground recreates an aged country road and can test up to five vehicles in parallel with reflector posts and pedestrian dummies.
- It provides reproducible, weather/time‑independent headlight testing integrated with the proving ground's *digital twin*, autonomous durability runs, an *artificial sun*, and rain simulation.
- The center joins a 1,285‑acre proving ground with 53 miles of test tracks that consolidates ~80% of road testing and has logged 62M miles, accelerating development and safety validation.

items.title: Plasma Treater Is Designed for Wide Coverage and High Speeds
Next-Generation Line Layouts Improve Efficiency
Are You Ready for Consumer-Driven Manufacturing?
items.author: Jennifer Pierce
items.summary:
- Consumer-driven manufacturing flips the traditional *push* model to a *pull* system, using real-time consumer demand and feedback to drive production.
- Success requires *real-time data* and **IoT**, modular factories and **digital twins** to enable agility, plus empowered cross-functional teams that can act without slow approvals.
- Tools like supply-chain visibility platforms, **AI**/analytics and virtual testing make demand-driven decisions actionable and help spot disruptions and trends early.

items.title: Airbus-Tata Launch India’s First Private H125 Helicopter FAL
items.summary:
- Airbus and Tata Advanced Systems will open India’s first private *Final Assembly Line* for the **H125** in Vemagal, Karnataka, producing the first *Made in India* H125 by early 2027.
- The line will serve both *civil* and *defense* markets — including EMS, disaster relief, tourism, law enforcement — and will also build a military **H125M** variant optimized for high‑altitude missions.
- The project expands the Airbus‑Tata partnership, boosts local content for India’s defense industrial base, and reflects Airbus’ deeper investment where it already sources **$1.4B** in annual components.

items.title: BMW Plants Honored for Lean Manufacturing
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- BMW’s Landshut and Wackersdorf plants won the 2025 Automotive Lean Production Award for boosting *flexibility* and *efficiency* in interior-component production.
- They employ *pull* (just-in-time) manufacturing, self-regulating supply loops and automated, *AI-supported* end-of-line inspections to streamline flow and detect defects early.
- BMW advocates *lean before digital*, combining lean value streams with automation and digital transformation to sustain quality and productivity gains.

items.title: Robots Handle Deformable Objects With Humanlike Dexterity
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- KAIST developed *INR‑DOM*, an *implicit neural representation* that reconstructs full 3D shapes of deformable objects from partial views, enabling robots to *imagine* unseen parts.
- A two-stage framework combining *reinforcement learning* and *contrastive learning* lets robots learn tasks (rubber-ring insertion, O‑ring installation, untying) with much higher success.
- This advances automated *cable/wire harness* assembly by addressing self-occlusion and the infinite degrees of freedom of flexible-object handling.

items.title: 2025 Assembly Plant of the Year: Deere Leaps Ahead With 5G Connectivity
Marelli Honored for Adhesive Wastewater Recovery System
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- Marelli developed a *three‑agent* chemical process that separates adhesive residue from cleaning water, enabling recovery and reuse of about **85%** of adhesive wastewater.
- Implemented at its Kyushu plant, the method cuts water consumption by 8,160 kg/year and converts industrial cleaning effluent into reusable nonpotable water.
- The approach aims to reduce industrial waste in *adhesive bonding* and may influence automotive manufacturing *sustainability* standards.

items.title: Competing Political Agendas Threaten Manufacturing Growth
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- An *ICE raid* detained about 475 mostly South Korean workers at an LG/Hyundai EV battery plant in Georgia, resulting in 316 deportations and diplomatic alarm that could jeopardize promised South Korean investment.
- Manufacturers say the workers were temporary specialist technicians and that *visa shortages* prevent lawful short-term deployment, putting *foreign direct investment* at risk amid trade talks.
- The author warns the U.S. must weigh strict immigration enforcement against promoting *manufacturing jobs* and EV/renewable growth as domestic manufacturing employment has already declined.

items.title: Northrop Grumman Opens Missile Integration Facility in WV
items.summary:
- Northrop Grumman opened a 113,000‑sq‑ft *Missile Integration Facility* in Rocket Center, WV to consolidate production, assembly, testing and shipping under one roof.
- The MIF is designed to produce up to **300 advanced strike missiles annually**, including the supersonic, extended‑range *AARGM‑ER* for the U.S. Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, and international partners.
- The facility is part of Northrop Grumman’s >$1 billion investment since 2018 to expand advanced weapons, propulsion, and *missile manufacturing* capacity.

items.title: 5G Technology Will Help American Manufacturers Stay Competitive
New Motion Control Tech Increases Flexibility
